inn1.comm: good length and nibbling away outside off, left alone cautiously
back of a length just outside off, Sibanda was caught between playing and leaving. He is late to drag his bat away,  slid away with half a bat past slip cordon
on a length and on the stumps, Sibanda comes forward and pushes it back to the bowler off the splice of the bat
good length, defended on top of off stump
Sami loses his radar as he sprays this one down leg. First wide of the day
veering down leg again, he does not meet with the glance. Off the pad and wanders away behind square on the leg side
inducker from Sami, Chibhabha was keeping back, perhaps expecting an away-going ball. He keeps it out to the leg side off an inner edge
good length ball curling in on middle and leg, flicked to the man at square leg
disciplined stuff. Not the worst thing to do with the new ball. Anwar explores the channel outside off, no shot offered
loose from Chibhabha. He slashes and misses a shortish ball outside off. He was crease-bound there as he threw his bat at it
on a length and outside off, driven on the rise to mid-off. Azhar Ali comes in, collects the ball quickly with two hands but misses a direct throw at the non-strikers'
shortish and climbs on top of off, Sibanda hangs on the back foot and diffuses it in front of the bowler
fuller and on off, he comes forward and capably blocks it to the covers
good length and just a shade outside off, it does not interest Chibhabha
Chibhabha weathers an lbw appeal. Fuller and on middle and leg, strikes the batsman on the front pad as he misses the flick. This was snaking down leg
back of a length and swerves in a touch on off, defended back to the bowler
lovely wristwork! Much fuller and on the pads, he picks it up, twirls his wrists and flicks it over midwicket
good length, holding its line on off, punched with a straight bat but finds mid-off
he camps back and punches this back-of-a-length delivery outside off to extra-cover
back of a length and tails in from outside off, keeps low to beat Chibhabha soundly
back of a length and outside off. Normal bounce and its punched to the man at short cover
waits on this good length ball on off, taps it to point and gets off to the other end
shortish and hurries on off, he loads up for a punchy drive and mis-hits it to short cover
pitched up and on off, push-and-run in front of mid-on. Wahab runs across to his left and collects the ball with one hand. He has a tape on his right hand
back of a length and on the stumps, forward and punched back to the bowler
beats third man with ease. Room on offer outside off, he leans back and cuts it crisply behind point. Wahab can't cut that off at deep third man
shortish and skiddy on off, defended off the splice of the bat
length on off, Chibhabha tips forward and turns it to midwicket
Chibhabha rides the bounce of this shortish one outside off and dabs it towards backward point
back of a length around off, Sibanda dabs this one behind point. No run here
short and zips through outside off with some extra bounce. He lets it be
good length around off, knocked behind point
tight line on off. Good length and defensively pushed back to the bowler with bat and pad close together
shortish and rises on off, punchily defended back to the bowler
he fetches this length ball outside off and flips it to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, punched off the back foot. Backward point runs to his right, dives across and makes a sharp save. Sami applauds the effort
good length and snakes in on off, he pushes lazily and manages an inside edge that wanders away behind square on the leg side
on a length and probes away outside off. Ignored
good length and just a shade outside off, punched to mid-off. Dot ball
Sami continues to tease the batsman outside off. Sibanda does not give away any quarter either, left alone
back of a length and on middle, poked out to the covers
Sami plugs away in the channel. He flags it through to the keeper
Sami caps off a maiden with another tempter. Sibanda hoists his bat above his shoulder and leaves
shot! Dug in short and wide outside off, Chibhabha pouches onto it. He keeps back and slaps it in the gap at the covers, fizzes away to the sweeper boundary
follows it up with a solid defence. Good length around off, blocked to the covers
pulls the pace off this ball, which stops on Chibhabha. Might have been a cutter, which is check-driven to mid-off
Anwar has his hands on his head. This was rather too full and straight, Chibhabha picks it away behind the square leg umpire and takes a four, second of the over
Chibhabha opens the face of his bat on impact with this length ball outside off and steers it neatly to deep third man for one
beaten emphatically! Good length ball outside off, kicks up on Sibanda. He has an uncertain waft at it, the ball zips past the groping bat and settles into the gloves of the keeper
calls for two and Chibhabha gets it. Flicks it behind square from an off-stump line. Impressive running between the wickets. Anwar wasn't quick enough
good length and outside off, he chases it, plays away from the body and misses it entirely, beaten on the outside edge
too full and straight, tucked away to midwicket
back of a length and outside off, slid down to backward point with an angled bat
good length on off, draws the batsman into a forward-defensive push to the covers
shortish and widish outside off, encourages the cut. Chibhabha does not need a second invitation as he cuts it between the two fielders at point
Sibanda makes a trip down the track, the bowler drags his length back, pushed to the covers
half-volley on off, he stands tall and punches it straight to mid-off

beats the man at deep backward square leg. On a length and on middle, might have been the change of pace. He picks it up and whips it over to the boundary. Chibhabha's wristwork has been a feature of this innings
and another... Back of a length and outside off, he leans back and cuts it through cover-point. Away she races to the sweeper boundary
he shuffles across off, takes this from outside off and works it through vacant midwicket
good length and outside off, Chibhabha tips forward and pushes it to mid-off
bounds in and shorts off with a short ball, tucks up Sibanda. Fended to the leg side
back of a length and outside off, Sibanda is content to let those ones pass
back of a length and on middle and leg, tucked through backward square leg. Intent from Sibanda. He scampers across for the first, hunts for the second. Has to settle with a single
he hops up and fends this short ball outside off to leg and takes off
Sibanda shuffles across off and blocks this good length ball on the stumps to leg
short and angling away outside off, glided down to third man with soft hands
looped up on off, blocked with bat and pad close together
tossed up legbreak outside off, he leans forward and pushes it to the covers for one
big appeal for lbw! This was on a length and slid through on middle, straightens and raps the batsman on the front pad. Sliding down
full and outside off, laced past the covers
pitched up on off, down the track and drilled down to long-off for one
slider from Yasir Shah, much quicker through the air. Defended to leg off the back foot
Wahab dishes out a lifting short ball on middle, blocked back to the bowler
good length ball, which is blocked to the covers
tucked off the hips through square leg
dug in on a shortish length and outside off, back-cut calmly to backward point
shortish and outside off, he looks to cut, gets a bottom edge in front of the keeper and scampers across for a single
floated up outside off, beaten
full and its driven to wide long-on for a single
on the leg stump line, Chibhabha needs to put bat on the ball. He does and gets a boundary
defended to the leg side
looks like Wahab is struggling with his line as he bowls one more on the leg stump. Chibhabha flicks it to midwicket for a single
good length ball outside the off stump. Sibanda plays it down with soft hands and sets off for a quick single ala Mark Waugh
comes forward and defends it back to the bowler
comes forward and pushes it to midwicket for a single
good length and round off, blocked to the leg side off the inner part of the bat
fifty for Chibhabha. He runs down the track, takes it on the full and drives it straight down the ground, beats long-on to his left
appeal for lbw from Yasir.. Good length, pushed through, strikes him in the front pad. Looked very close but not given
fuller and outside off, down the track and sliced to the off side
flatter and quicker, down the track and takes it on the pad
googly from Yasir, Sibanda does not pick it. He pushes and manages an inside edge onto the pad
worked to the leg side
full and on off, he comes down the track and blocks it
flighted and on off, he uses his feet and presses it to the covers
back of a length and outside off, punched off the back foot to the covers
floated up and outside off, he pushes away from the body, throws his bat at it and is beaten
fuller and on middle and leg, he sinks to one knee and pastes a slog-sweep over deep midwicket. Beats Malik in the deep
pitched up and outside off, driven past the covers
shortish and on middle, he backs away and slashes it to the covers
slid through on middle, mishit slog-sweep over midwicket
Sibanda has been put out of his misery.. Hafeez strikes. Nicely tossed up on off and spins in, he nips down the track and gets beaten in flight. Hafeez hits the off stump
fuller and on off, driven down to long-on
fuller and on off, pushed back to the bowler
flat and on off, he goes down on one knee and sweeps behind square leg on the leg side
flatter length on middle and leg, tucked away through midwicket
fuller and around off, forward and pushed back to the bowler
flighted and outside off, down the track and driven to long-off
pushed through flat and outside off, he keeps back and punches it to the covers
driven to long-on from the off stump
full on middle, chipped towards long-on
straight ball on middle, he goes down on one knee and sweeps it behind square on the leg side
punched down to long-on
flighted and outside off, he lunges forward and pushes it to the covers
fuller and on middle, swept to short fine leg
fired down leg, wide called
good length and on off, driven down to long-on
quick and flat on off stump, defended
tosed up and luring him outside off, Chibhabha drives into the covers
ties him down on off stump, Chibhabha has to get his bat down quickly because this seemed like the flipper
drags it short and allows the batsman to camp back and cut to deep point
flighted on and around off stump, nudged through midwicket
appeared keen on midwicket again, but this pitches and turns just enough to prey on his decision to play across the line. Hits him on the pad, but it might still have slid down
down the track, gets to the pitch and drives to long-off. Brings up the hundred
good length ball, lifted over his left shoulder with a lap sweep
punches to mid-off, flatter delivery handled from deep in the crease
stays back considering the lack of flight and drills to extra cover
picked up the length early and swept it behind square. Hami M's power takes care of the rest. Giant stride forward to get him close enough to swing away
pushes to long-on
good length angled in on off, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length and on off, punched down to long-on
fuller length angling away outside off, dabbed behind point
back of a length and on the hips, he can't connect with the flick
edged and sneaks away through the vacant slip cordon. Good length and angling away outside off,  Hami M stays back, hangs his bat out and nicks it for a fortunate four to third man
length ball on off, he skips out, shuffles across off and clips it through midwicket
loopy breakbreak, pitches on off and rips away outside off beating the push of Hami M

And he comes into business. The umpire's forefinger goes up but Masakadza shakes his head as he walks back. This was flighted on off stump, he sinks down to one knee but does not connect with the attempted reverse sweep. Not sure if the ball had popped off the forearm or the glove. Hafeez dives forward to take a low catch. Masakadza has to drag himself off the field..
pushed through on the pads, helped fine on the leg side. Hammad fumbles in the deep and gives away an extra run
full and outside off, he runs it away towards point
tossed up on middle, blocked to midwicket
flat on off, punched off the back foot to mid-off
back of a length and angling away outside off, pushed to mid-off
banged in shortish and on off, mishit pull in front of square on the leg side
dug in short and climbs on middle, Williams keeps back, chops it in front of point. The fielder comes in to attack the ball but does not collect it cleanly
shortish and on the hips, helped away behind square on the leg side
yorker right at the base of middle, swings in late. Williams jabs his bat down and digs it out to the leg side
short, bumpy ball outside off. Williams arches his back and lets it through to the keeper
flighted and on middle, knocked gently in front of midwicket after prodding forward
good length on off, Chibhabha keeps back and punches one down to long-off
leg-stumpish and shorter in length as he sees Williams come down the track. Check-flicked behind square leg
Chips a soft return catch. Tossed up invitingly on middle. Williamson strides forward, aims to drive, instead he lobs it back to the bowler, who snaps it up near chest-height
flighted and turning away outside off, pushed to the covers
fuller and on off, down the track and driven to the covers
shortish and sprays it wide outside off. Left alone
back of a length and outside off, punched out to the off-side sweeper
fullish and on off, clipped to mid-on, straight to the fielder
back of a length and on off, this one stays low. Pushed towards backward point
on a length and outside off, he steps forward and drives it neatly to sweeper cover. Looked like a mere push
on a length and on off, secures a single to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Sibanda gets on top of the bounce and punches it crisply to sweeper cover
fullish and on off, leans forward and drives it to long-off
straight roller on middle, nudged to the leg side
slid through outside off on a flat trajectory, Chami Chibhabha flashes hard and manages a thick outside edge to the right of the keeper. Runs away to third man
fullish and on middle, worked behind square on the leg side
half-tracker on off, he rocks back and pulls it straight to midwicket
flat on middle, punched to sweeper cover
on a length and outside off, flashes and does not connect. Beaten
good length ball on off, driven past the covers to wide mid-off. There is a communication breakdown. But they eventually decline the single
good length on off, forward and driven to mid-off. Raza half-waves his bat to Chibhabha

impressive timing. Good tag-team work at cow corner. This was too full and straight, flicked away through midwicket. Deep midwicket runs across to his left and lobs the ball to the chasing mid-on fielder
he opens the face of his bat to this back of a length ball outside off to the right of deep third man. They press for two and complete it with ease
banged in short and has enough legs to rise on off. He leaps off his feet and quells it behind square on the leg side
flatter and spinning away, played out to sweeper cover off the back foot
skiddy ball, hurries on middle, blocked to leg
flighted and spins in, googly. He lunges on the push and manages an inside edge on the pad
flighted and full on off, pushes away from the body and gets an inside edge onto the pad again
pushed through quicker on middle, some turn. Poked to the covers
fuller and on off, Raza presses forward and drives it to long-off

low full toss on the leg stump with a 'hit me' label on it. However, Raza glances it straight to short fine. He nearly ran himself out, belatedly responding to Chibhabha's single. They make it in the end
good length and on off, milked down to long-on
back of a length and outside off, stops on Raza, who executes a punchy drive to sweeper cover
good length and on off, jabbed defensively back to the bowler
on a length and outside off, Raza flows forward and finds mid-off with a drive
slower cutter outside off as Hammad sucks the pace off it. Neatly pushed to the man sweeping the boundary on the off side
flighted and full on middle, which is driven down to long-on
angled on middle, nudged in front of midwicket for a speedy single
flatter on the stumps, pushed back at the bowler
drifting onto the pads, down on one knee and swept firmly to long leg
length ball on middle, slow through the air. Turned in front of mid-on
Malik held this one back further, fuller and on off. Whippily driven to long-on
Azam errs too full and straight, flicked away through midwicket
fuller and outside off, wristy drive to the left of extra cover for a speedy single
overpitched on off, forward and drilled down to long-on
slippery slower short ball outside off. Raza does not decipher it. He revvs up into an early pull and is beaten
width on offer outside off. Raza throws his bat at a drive and manages a thick outer edge to third man
fuller and on middle, clipped straight to midwicket
Raza comes down the track and yorks himself. Jammed out to midwicket
flatter on middle, whipped through midwicket off the back foot

Strangled down leg for 99. Given out.. He shakes his head before looking skywards. This was an innocuous ball drifting down leg, Chibhabha seeks to help it away with a sweep but does not get hold of it. I think he did not touch the ball even as Sarfraz hung onto a sharp catch, moving to his left. Chibhabha has to wait for his maiden century
sliding across off, he hangs his bat out and is beaten
full and on middle, worked towards midwicket
straight length ball, blocked in front of midwicket
fuller and outside off, driven to sweeper cover
good length and outside off, he keeps back and pushes it through cover-point
picked away off the pads to short fine leg (Wahab) for one. Raza should have put that away. Wahab misses a direct hit at the strikers'

They go to the TV umpire. Mutumbami has lost his bat. NOT OUT is the call. On a length and outside off, Mutumbami pushes at it and gets an inner edge to short fine leg, sets off. Wahab nails a direct hit at the non-strikers' end. Top throw. Mutumbami's bat had got stuck into the turf as he tried to slide his bat in. He manages to sprint over, lands his foot down just before the bails came off
back of a length and outside off, slashed to point. Diving save
back of a length and outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
full and angled across off, run away to short third man
top strike. Full and on middle, Raza gets under it and hoists it over long-off, its strikes the ad cushions on the flush. The outcome is a six
leg-stumpish, swept through midwicket
slid through on the leg stump, he misses the sweep, off the pad and beats the keeper
pushed through on middle, whipped past midwicket
veering down leg, another sweep missed and they cross over for a leg bye
good length and angling away, pushed to the man at backward point
shortish and on middle, cramps the batsman for room. Clipped through midwicket
back of a length and on middle, blocked back to the bowler
lifter angled across, Raza sways his upper body out of the way
Raza hops up and flicks this shortish ball to deep midwicket
on a fuller length and angling away outside off, Muthumbami chases with a booming drive but does not connect
punched down to long-on for one
back of a length and outside off, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length and outside off, he opens his bat face and steers it between covers and backward point
back of a length and on middle, played to backward point with an open face
crunched! On a length and outside off, he plants his front foot forward and lashes it past the covers. Sped away to the boundary
slower short ball, worked in front of square on the leg side
back of a length and just a shade outside off, turned in front of mid-on for a hustled single
worked in front of square on the leg side for one
back of a length and on off, Raza loads up and slogs it away to the deep midwicket boundary with some power
pitched up and angling away outside off, change-up from Wahab. Hoodwinks Raza. He slashes and does not connect
bouncer flies over a ducking Raza to Sarfraz
shortish and rises on off, Raza hops up and rides the bounce to deep third man
fuller and on off, down on one knee and swept through backward square leg
quicker on off, Mutumbami hangs back, aims to turn to leg, gets a leading edge in front of the covers
pushed back to the bowler
Outstanding fielding. Hammad runs across to his left from deep fine leg, dives to his left and stops this well-timed sweep. He also lets rip a good throw
pushed through on middle and leg, flicked through midwicket
full and outside off, pushed to the covers
back of a length and on off, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length and on middle and leg, he misses the flick and takes it on the thigh
low full toss on middle, tripe ball. He shuffles across and picks it up and over backward square leg. Anwar's yorker went awry
dug in short and wide outside off, slammed to sweeper cover
change of pace, slower and outside off. Early into a push and beaten
on a good length and outside off, laced to the covers
fifty for Raza. Full on middle and leg, swept away behind square leg for a hustled two. He earns a smattering of applause from the crowd
fuller and outside off, pressed to the covers
slower through the air on middle, poked to the covers
loads up for a sweep and does not get hold of it. Off the inner edge and sneaks away behind square leg
length on middle, down the track and clipped to midwicket
fired outside off, he flashes with firm hands and gets beaten
mid-off in the ring and Raza cashes in. On a length and outside off, he steps away and powers it away over the fielder. Change-up and dispatched
Anwar misses the yorker and pays penalty. Knee-high full toss on middle, helped away to the backward square leg boundary. He did not larrup it. Raza just gave it direction
length and on off, eased to long-off
down the track, swishes at this back of a length one outside off. But does not connect. Undone by the slower ball
length delivery on off, drilled back to the bowler, who bends low in his followthrough to stop the ball

The slow, short ball does the trick... Mutumbami nips down the track, Anwar bangs it short and slows it up. Mutumbami can't force it away. He can't manufacture his own pace as he spoons a simple catch to Shafiq at cover
back of a length and angling away outside off, dabbed to backward point. The fielder effects a direct hit at strikers' but Coventry had made his ground after setting off
banged in short and rises on middle, Coventry yanks his bottom hand off the bat as he steers it to third man
slower bouncer, he slips under it
Raza is gone.. Oh no, no, no that's a big no ball. Short and wide outside off, slapped into the hands of Yasir at backward point. But it does not count
Wahab serves up a length ball on middle, Raza clears his front leg and clobbers it over midwicket for a six
slips in a slower bouncer angling away, Raza ducks under
slower length ball outside off, opens the bat face and helps it away between backward point and short third man with soft hands
bumper on the leg stump, might have been a slower ball. Coventry hunkers down
nails a yorker, right in the blockhole on off, squeezed to short third man with an open face
on a length and outside off, loads up for a lash through the off side and skews it towards long-on off the inner part of the bat
wide yorker outside off, Raza backs away and slices it up and over short third man. Not pretty but effective
yorker at the base of leg, makes room and drills it to long-on
Sami fires a yorker on off, he manages an inside edge onto the pad and scurries to the other end
Raza backs away outside leg, Sami hurls a yorker. Dug out for none
swing and a miss to a back of a length ball outside off
Wahab attempts a slower ball bouncer, does not have enough legs. Coventry clears his front leg and pummels it over deep midwicket with a swat-pull
fuller and on middle, Coventry makes room outside leg and carves it over backward point
low full toss outside off, thick edge skews to deep third man as he does not connect with the drive properly
Coventry nicks off now. Mighty full, near yorker outside off. Coventry makes room but can't swing it away. He only manages an outer edge that is swallowed by Sarfraz
He aims to work it around to the leg side but has to settle with a leading edge behind point, sneaks towards third man
crackin' hit. Sami hints for a yorker on off, but errs too full. He gets under it and smears it over the covers
Raza steps away outside leg, Sami dishes out a full toss, which is smashed over extra cover again
short and wide outside off, Raza throws his bat at it and carves it up and over backward point to the right of third man. Poor throw and the keeper can't collect it. Easy couple
Raza goes Boom again! Banged in short and on middle and leg, he rocks back and pastes a pull over the deep midwicket fielder
length and outside off, drilled to the covers
very full and on off, slid off towards point with an angled bat
yorker, right in the blockhole on off, squirted back to the bowler
full and on middle, pushed towards the covers for a single
wide yorker outside off. Creamer can't slice it away. He can't put bat on it

the sub fielder takes it. The umpires check for a possible no ball. Creamer has been asked to wait. It is a legal ball and Creamer has to depart. Change in pace. Full on off, he wants to hoist it over cover but does not connect well. Skewed off the toe end of the bat to Shehzad
pitched up and on middle, cracked to sweeper cover
low full toss outside off, he can't slap it away
lands just in front of cover. Well-disguised slower short ball. Raza steps away and flat-bats it in front of the man at cover
drifting down leg, he can't glance it away. Off the thigh to short fine leg for a leg bye
slower short ball outside off, pulled in front of deep midwicket. Raza moves onto 99

century for Raza. He eases the helmet off his head and soaks up the healthy applause. Panyangara congratulates Raza. Slower ball, Raza waits on it before semi-pulling and semi-flicking it to deep square leg
Panyanhara shuffles across off, Anwar does not get hold of the yorker. This low full toss is tickled fine on the leg side
slower short ball outside off. Panyangara can't connect

inn2.comm: back of a length delivery comes back in off the seam. Beats Azhar and perhaps stays a touch low as well while going through to the keeper
more cut back in for Panyangara. Azhar walks down, covers his off stump and hoists the bat over his head
pitches it further up to keep the two slips in play, but the ball is a touch too straight and he pushes down to mid-on
shortish and outside off, Azhar blocks down the pitch. Nor particularly off the middle of the bat
leans forward and blocks towards cover. Testing length and line just outside off
that's fast becoming his signature shot in limited-overs cricket. Walking down the track, like he's at a park, and flick through leg. This time he's threaded the gap at midwicket
full on off stump, pushed to mid-on. Dibbly-dobbly medium pace.
good length ball outside off, defended into the off side
lunges forward outside off and he's into the push through cover a bit too early. Gets an inside edge behind square leg
slips down leg, helped away to long leg
good length ball on off stump, blocked
a little width on offer and Sarfraz has sliced it behind point. He's not looking to race away, a conscious effort, seems to me.
doesn't do that too often, lose his discipline and provide a limp, fuller ball way down leg
gets this to straighten after angling the good length ball in on middle and leg. Azhar is mindful of it and blocks
neat little tap to mid-on as Panyangara bowls full and straight
steps forward to a good length ball on off stump and blocks. Searches for a single, but short cover denies him the chance
a good dive to his right at short cover stops a push from Azhar. Tight bowling again, on and around off stump
walks at the medium-pacer, who promptly pulls his length back and targets the body. Azhar clips it off his hips to long leg
back of a length delivery outside off, Sarfraz wants to drop and run towards point. No such luck
goes quite wide of the crease for the full delivery on leg stump, Azhar hasn't timed it well enough. Perhaps an inside edge off his pads for a single towards fine leg
back of a good length on off stump, Sarfraz punches to mid-on
picks the gap to the left of mid-off, and is helped out by the fielder letting the ball through. Poor effort from Brian Vitori, it would appear
a hint too straight, Sarfraz glances to the man at short fine leg
this time he draws mid-off to run forward and to his left, more than enough time to hustle across for a single
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-on
deep square leg is back so he waits for the shortish delivery on the pads and exploits it with a flick

seemed to get a little more kick out of the deck. It was pitched on a good length outside off and Azhar was on the walk again, looking to drive on the up. Has to adjust and soften his hands and settle for a block
a shimmy down the track and a slice through the covers. Saw the yawning gap, had gotten himself into a good position on the front foot to force the ball through
full on middle, turned to short midwicket
goes forward to a slightly back of a length delivery and pushes to mid-off
runs down the track, Panyangara had wised up to the tactic and bowls the slower ball. With no pace to work with, Azhar's slog is mistimed to mid-on

out come the audacious strokes. I'm surprised it too so long. Barely threatening medium pace from Mupariwa, this one was full and outside off. Sarfraz gets down low and sweeps to the square leg boundary.
good length ball outside off, drilled to mid-on
short and wide, Sarfraz waits for it to pass him before he plants the open face down and picks a couple to deep third man
low full toss outside off, whipped straight at short midwicket. Practices the stroke after the fact. Yep, should have done better
full on middle and leg, tucked away behind square leg
sweet! A bit too full, a bit too wide and he caresses it through the covers. A little extension of the arms, as if he were persuading the ball to speed away
tries to tuck him up, but Sarfraz is quite comfortable with a flick behind square leg
back of a length and on fifth stump, I'd imagine, blocked
offcutter on off stump, Sarfraz had picked it early for he was wading into a drive to mid-on
good length ball on off stump, Sarfraz protects his sticks
takes it from way outside off, rotates his wrists to give it the power needed to find a single behind square leg. Batting miles outside the crease
sits up for the pull and he obliges. The leg side field was up in front of square and Azhar merely helps himself
walks towards the bowler, turns a back of a length delivery to a length ball and pushes into the covers
good length on off stump, covers the angle across the right-hander, and blocks
gets forward - rather strides forward - and across on off stump to find a single to long leg
back of a length on off stump, defended
"we want six" chants the crowd, Azhar appeases them with a powerful pull. Well in front of square. Vitori really shouldn't be bowling that short
fullish on off stump, pulls his front leg back so his bat can come down freely and push to mid-off
slipping down the leg side. Full and on middle, Sarfraz falls over the flick and wears it on his front pad. Not given
back of a length and straight, Sarfraz shuffles across and tucks it neatly through midwicket
very full and on off, Sarfraz flicks it to the right of short midwicket. The fielder dives and takes some pace off the ball

plumb and the forefinger goes up. Chibhabha strikes in his first over after being becoming the first Zimbabwe player to be out on 99. Sarfraz, who was standing outside the crease, shuffles across and misses the sweep to a full, straight ball in front of middle. Smacked on the back pad
back of a length and on middle, turned in front of square on the leg side
Azhar walks at the bowler. Chibhabha is wary of it as he drags his length back, clipped towards mid-on
good length and angling away, Hafeez responds with a forward-defensive push to mid-off
full and sliding away outside off, ignored
similar ball outside off. No shot offered
back of a length and around off, Hafeez clips it wristily to the right of mid-on. The fielder dives and stops the ball
Azhar Ali shuffles across and flicks this back-of-a-length ball towards midwicket
good length and attacking off, Hafeez presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
good length ball on middle, Azhar shuffles across off and turns it to midwicket. The fielder Creamer I guess denies him a single
full and straight, Azhar walks across again as he wrists this one square on the leg side
b-e-a-u-t--i-f-u-l. A tad overpitched on middle, Hafeez leans across and flicks it to the right of mid-on, skims away to the boundary. Hafeez punches gloves with Azhar
pitched up and on off, draws Hafeez into a forward defensive push towards mid-on
Hafeez runs down the track, he drags his length back. Check-pushed back to the bowler
pitched up and outside off, Hafeez presses forward and pushes it to short cover
fuller ball on off stump, Azhar gives some work for mid-off
gets the ball to move back at him just enough to leave Azhar in a bit of trouble. But he's able to get the flick down quick enough and send the ball to long leg
shortish and outside off, pushed into the covers
great timing from Hafeez, but there is a man prowling at deep point. It was a good length ball outside off, he got on top of the bounce and drives with the open face
good length ball on off stump, drilled to the sweeper again
hammered. The short ball peeks out, as if hoping to surprise the batsman. But Hafeez swivels on the back foot and swats it away. Too slow. Too easy
starts with a short one, Azhar flat-bats it to long-on
that's better. Tosses the ball up on middle and gets enough turn to keep the batsman to a forward defensive
gets a little drift going with a flighted delivery on off stump, blocked
leans forward to block a good length ball on off stump
flighted on off stump, eased down to long-off
flighted on off stump, Azhar tries to reach the pitch but can't. Seems to be pushing at the ball away from his body with an open face. But it's safe
good length ball outside off, punched to deep point

ricochet off the stumps allows a single. Azhar had stepped forward to a full length ball and drove it down the ground. The bowler gets a hand to it and tries to get it onto the stumps at the bowler's end. Succeeds in doing so but the non-striker is safe.
back of a length on off stump, blocked
gets up on his toes to punch into the covers. Shortish again
slid down to point. Stays beside the ball and leads with his hands, but Hafeez's timing is still spot on
fuller delivery outside off, driven to mid-off to retain strike
beautiful flight from Cremer. But Hafeez leans into a serene drive to long-off. Made a hint of room and stretched to reach the pitch
a little skip down the track and Azhar flicks a tossed up delivery on the pads to long-on

excellent work on the long-off boundary. But this was as much the bowler's trick. Looped the ball up over Hafeez's eyeline, made him play just enough away from his body to ensure his timing wouldn't be as good and the chip carries only as far as Coventry - who runs to his left and slides to take a smart, low catch
flighted on and around off stump, defended stoutly
that was poor - offers a short ball that the batsman shuffles back and across to and cuts to deep point
moves back and cuts away away. Perhaps I jinxed him by lauding his flight...
sliding save on the cover boundary from Sibanda. Doesn't take anything away from the on-the-up drive through the covers. Neatly through the gap of the three-man ring
good length ball outside off, eased to point
shortish and on the pads, milked for a single to long leg
good length ball going on with the left-armer's angle, shoulders arms
full on off stump, Azhar wanted mid-off and he does... only the fielder had to move to his right to control an inside edge and the drive goes down the ground instead
glanced to long leg as the bowler strays short and down leg again
loops it up on middle and off, drags the batsman forward. Shafiq smothers it with a drive to mid-off
a shade flatter, and Shafiq jumps back to whip the ball to long-on
goes back quite quickly and slices the slightly shortish ball through to deep point
a little uncertain there from the batsman as Cremer is getting the ball to turn. But he hasn't tossed this one up and allows the batsman the time to adjust. Punched to long-on
shortish and outside off, cut away to point
flighted on off stump, safely defended
goes back, makes room and plays a back cut. Hami M is the man at short third man, and he misfields and offers an easy run
steps back and slices a shortish delivery through to deep point
down the track this time and pushes a good length ball through to deep point again
slider on middle and leg, whipped towards midwicket. Only just, as well, because that ball hurried on him
tossed up on off stump, defended
pushed through on off stump, Azhar looks to go back and cut. Isn't all that short and he gets a toe end to cover
flighted on off stump, eased to cover
flighted on leg stump, clipped through mdiwicket
runs down the track and turns a flighted delivery into a low full toss, whips to deep square leg
shortish on middle, Shafiq goes back and unleashes a short-armed pull to deep midwicket
looped up, ends up a full toss, drilled through extra cover. Gift offered and gobbled up
flighted outside off, sliced behind point. Opens the face to make sure he can get a couple of singles
short, turns away from the batsman. Shafiq counts on it as he clears that front leg and cuts to deep point
turned away through midwicket, and again it's a pretty flat delivery allowing the batsman to play off the back foot
tossed up this time, and Shafiq is down the track to drive into the covers
a little turn as he hits a good length and pulls the batsman to reach with his hands outside off. Defended
gone to a shorter length, and it's been cut away to point

another short ball, but it takes ages to arrive to the batsman. Shafiq had set up on his back foot and needs to wait on his pull. Mistimes it, nonetheless, and is nearly snaffled up by the shortmidwicket fielder. Didn't jump too high
shortish and outside off, cracked to deep point
steps down the track to a flighted delivery on leg stump, nudged through midwicket
some turn outside off, Azhar rides it with a cut to point

gets his fifty, he's been getting to that mark repeatedly since his appointment as ODI captain. Salutes the crowd who are quite generous with their applause after he flicks a short ball thorugh midwicket
short again, but this time with width, so Shafiq cuts to deep point
tossed up on off stump, blocked
oooh, that was close! Williams and his darts nearly work as the arm ball hits the inside edge and wanders to short fine leg. Very late there, was Azhar
appeal from the keeper as he misses a flick. Hit low enough, but that would have gone down leg
steps down to a good length ball and pushes towards mid-on
it's a short ball again, outside off. Cut to deep point
steps down and whips to deep point
goes back and uses a straight bat to punch a flatter delivery through the covers
down the track to turn a flighted delivery into a full toss, but it is a low one. Skews off the bottom of the bat as he flicks to deep square leg
the whip's on display. Tossed up delivery on middle and leg, Azhar waits for it and rolls his wrists on top of it for a single to wide long-on
lunges forward and keeps a loopy delivery on off stump out
quick feet get him nearly to the pitch of the ball, after which he doesn't need to worry so much about hitting against the turn. Single to deep midwicket
dropped by short cover? It was a long hop and Azhar had cracked it to the left of the fielder. Chibhabha had to dive but it was still coming at a decent height. Should have taken it
this short ball, however, is cut away along the ground to deep point

run out chance! But the man coming around from midwicket wasn't quick enough. Sibanda was the man, who had Shafiq quite nervous after the batsman had raced down the track and run with the nudge into the leg side. He was halfway down, had to turn, and yet the throw is way too slow
steps down, and despite the ball being flat, can easily tap it down to long-on
tossed up outside off, pushed to the left of the bowler
good length ball outside off, tucked away through midwicket
good length ball, dabbed into the covers for a quick single
tossed up on and around middle, Azhar gets himself inside the line and drives to cover
tossed up outside off, sliced towards point
almost a yorker on off stump, jams his bat down and skews it to point. Hami M misfields at point and allows the run
flatter delivery outside off, cut to deep point
down the track to push the ball through to long-on
flighted outside off, clipped towards midwicket. Nowhere near controlled though, as he gets a bit of an inside edge while rolling his wrists
back of a length on off stump, tapped to long-on
fuller length outside off, Shafiq gets into a flowing drive to cover
fuller delivery outside off, flayed away behind point. Appeared a thick outside edge
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
down the track and heaved over mid-on. Forceful stroke without much force behind it because he hadn't got close enough to the ball and it took the inside edge
back of a length and outside off, seemed to kick up off the pitch. Azhar blunts it well enough with soft hands and picks up a single to long-on
tossed up on middle and leg, turned away through midwicket
flighted on middle and off, blocked
a shorter delivery outside off, cut away to point
that's been middled. He's been attempting that shot for a while, running down the track and whipping away over midwicket. This time he's managed to get to the pitch and that helps him out greatly
good length ball outside off, pushed down the ground
flighted on leg stump, driven to long-on
fuller ball outside off, he reaches for it and attempts a flick. Doesn't connect well enough, and appeared he was too soon into the stroke as well
good length ball outside off, punched to deep cover
full on off stump, tapped back at the bowler. Was in the air for the smallest while, but it falls short of him
fuller ball on off stump, whirls his wrists in the hope of getting the gap on the leg side. Doesn't

has he stopped it at the extra cover boundary? Hami M was the man chasing a lovely little lift over the covers. But it looks like his knee was in contact with the rope as he was pulling the ball back. Good shot from Azhar that
takes it from off stump and flicks through midwicket
gets down the pitch, the bowler pulls his length back and all that happens is a perfect forward defensive. What an anti-climax
worked through the leg side for a single. They've done that well in this partmership
another nudge to the right of midwicket as Shafiq gets forward and across to take it from off stump
low full toss outside off, miscued towards short cover
drags it short and it's pulled to deep square leg
fired in on middle and leg, that's the Williams arm ball again. Goes for a flick, didn't quite connect
full on middle and off, driven to long-on
presents the full face to an attempted yorker on middle. Midwicket gets across to cut the single
good length on off stump, this time's it's been pushed past short midwicket even as he dives to his left
a bit too straight and Azhar leans forward and flicks to deep square leg

slips through his legs at mid-off, Mupariwa is the culprit there. The batsman had come down and was caught in two minds, whether to lift it over the infield or keep it along the ground. Goes on the bounce to the fielder, who settled nicely behind it. Only for the ball to sneak through his legs
this time the arm ball stays low, and yet it doesn't beat the batsman. Williams is a bit miffed as he sees Shafiq get an inside edge
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
flighted on off stump, driven back down the pitch
skips down the track and whips it away to deep square leg. Tries to power it away, but the ball had ended up cramping him
umpteenth time they're running at the bowler, worked away to deep square leg
steps out and turns a flighted delivery through midwicket
stays inside the line and drives a loopy delivery outside off to long-off
that's nicely bowled. Drifts the ball on middle and leg and gets it to turn. Shafiq is wary as he blocks

excellent work, and Zimbabwe are back in it. Runs down the track and hopes to exploit the vacant midwicket region, but Cremer is getting the ball to dip and turn. Very risky option, and the leading edge results. Raza at short cover runs in, dives and plucks a good one
flighted outside off, defended
good length on middle and leg, tucked away to deep square leg

one-handed effort from the man at backward point, the ball comfortably beats it to the backward point boundary. He's been bowling flat all day, this one's short as well and Mpofu, the substitute, exhibits a poor display. Dives over the ball
down the track to push to long-on
good length outside off, pushed into the covers
takes it on the full and flicks it to the midwicket boundary. He's not spinning the ball, no danger in advancing on the bowler. Clever stroke
flighted on off stump, defended
good length ball on and around off stump - this one doesn't turn - edgy Haris tries to defend and gets an inside edge
driven with the full face of the bat as he leans forward to the pitch of a tossed up ball on leg stump
drags this short though and it's been pulled to deep midwicket
gets the ball to drift in and beat Azhar on the flick. Plays across the line and wears it on the pad. He's miles outside the crease though, so no need to appeal
goes back to try and cut a slightly shorter delivery. Not enough room though, even as he makes some for himself, and he gets a thick outside edge to deep third man
slips one down leg and it's been helped along to long leg
moves away from the good length ball on middle and guides it to cover
good length ball on middle, tapped back to long-off
goes on the bounce to long-on as Haris goes for a pull when the ball was flat and didn't give him the room he sought
turned away to short fine leg as Raza targets the pads
worked away to deep square leg as Raza practices a leg-stump line again
full on middle, tapped down to long-on
plants half a bat on a back of a length delivery to get a single to deep third man
fuller delivery outside off, he reaches for it but doesn't go hard at the ball. Guided to cover
drive and run to mid-off, Azhar was a shade sluggish in getting off and it did look quite risky. Had that hit the stumps direct, he might well have been out
width offered and that's where Haris likes it, flays it away through deep point
leading edge almost carries to cover! Haris looks for to flick a good length ball angled across him, and nearly pays for the mistake
fired in on the pads, nudged through midwicket for an easy couple
flat and on the pads again, clipped to deep midwicket
advances on the bowler and drives to long-on
pitching outside leg, turning far enough to arrive at his pads. Flicked to short fine leg. Zimbabwe are trying to strangle Pakistan
elegantly lifted to the long-off boundary. Eases down the track, all his momentum coming forwards into the shot. Timing takes it away
fired in on middle and leg, clipped behind square leg
good length on off stump, blocked to cover
fuller delivery on off stump, glided to point
back of a length on off stump, run down to short third man
a couple of bounces and over extra cover. Got down, made room as he was doing so and extends a defense. Excellent stroke. Got the elevation he wanted since no one was there on the boundary
shortish and outside off, sliced to backward point
tries to hit the gap between short third man and point, the latter of which dives to his right and saves a boundary
full toss on the pads, whipped to wide long-on
nudged to midwicket this time. The leg-stump attack really isn't bottling the runflow
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
flighted on middle, Azhar tucks it to deep square leg
down the track to take a full toss and bunt it down to long-on

that's hundred! Tossed up delivery on leg stump, tickled around the corner towards the long leg boundary and the Lahore crowd cry out in delight. Excellently controlled innings from the Pakistan captain.
fuller delivery outside off, driven towards mid-off
shortish and on the pads, Azhar nips a single to short fine leg. That's the fifty partnership as well
shortish on off stump, Haris gets up on his toes to push it back at the bowler
back of a length on off stump, driven to long-on
fuller delivery outside off, sliced to point
picks up a length ball and deposits it over the long-off boundary. His ability to chip the ball is quite striking

he has! With a short ball that's beem smashed straight to point. Nothing particularly threatening about the ball, should really have done a lot better with that. But after scoring 102, perhaps some tiredness crept in. We can give him some slack. Good innings, set up the chase very well.
another short and wide delivery - perhaps a slower bouncer - and it's been hammered through point
tries to pull off a late cut against a good length ball, doesn't connect
slower ball on the pads, turned away to short fine leg
good length ball on middle, tapped to long-on

fuller delivery outside off, blocked into the covers for a quick single.... which becomes more a the fielder has a shy at the bowler's end and gives away an overthrow. Too many fielding gaffes from Zimbabwe
precision mark! Went back and away from the line of a short ball with a hint of width, and then let his hands take care of the rest. Sliced away past the diving point. Top shot
shortish and outside off, gets on top of the ball and dabs it to deep third man
fuller ball on middle and leg, Haris looks for a flick and is struck on the pads. Slower ball has muddled the batsman. Would have slipped down though
back of a length and outside off, punched to long-off
opts for the late cut and gets the ball well to the left of the point fielder. Good work from Malik again, finding the gaps pretty quickly
starts with a short one that's been cut to deep point
tossed up on off stump, Haris works it watchfully to square leg
skips down the track to find a single to long-on
good length ball outside off, tapped through midwicket
goes back to flick a good length ball through midwicket
not the best end to a good spell. Bowls short and Haris punishes him with a well-timed cut behind point
opens the face of a fuller ball and it's too good for deep third man. Calculated strokeplay from Malik, knew if he got that fine enough he wouldn't need to take further risks in the over
full and slanted at the pads, hits them as he misses the flick, and it goes for a single to square leg
back of a length on leg stump, tucked away to square leg
full and wide outside off, to trump the batsman looking to wander away down leg
shortish on off stump, punched into the covers
fuller delivery outside off, Haris chases after it with a cut. Beaten
good length outside off, Malik drags it to deep midwicket
seems he hasn't shied away from the late cut yet. Watches the ball quite carefully and slices it away quite fine amid the crowd chanting "Zim-bab-we"
clean! It was overpitched outside off and Malik got under it and powered it over extra cover. Stunning hit, first one of the innings
good length ball on middle and leg, tapped to long-on
slower ball in response to the batsman skipping down the track, caressed through the covers
banged in short, Malik swivels on his back foot and pulls to long leg
back of a length and on off stump, slid to point
fuller delivery outside off, slapped away over cover
outside edge bisects third man running in from the boundary and point running back. Haris races down the track, gets a bouncer for his troubles. Reaches for it with a slash and survies
good length ball on off stump, blocked
full on middle, almost a yorker, drilled down the ground to long-on
in the slot and Malik pastes it away to the long-off boundary. Help yourself medium pace is further impaired by a featherbed of a track
fuller ball on middle, Malik moves away beside the ball this time and crashes it through cover. That's fifty for this pair off only 37 balls. Terrific little cameo here from the comeback man
inside edge onto pad as he looks to flick a good length ball off his pads and away to square leg. Ends up settling for a single to point
lots of width and Malik scythes it over cover. There is protection there though
full and angled in on leg stump, Haris goes for a slog. Appears like he's got an inside edge onto pad and then down to third man

lovely drive through cover. That's his fifty. It's that lift over the off side that he looks so good playing. Gets down the track, and beside the ball to have all the room he needs to reach the boundary
a delicate little dab to third man finishes it off. That's Pakistan's third successful chase of 250-plus in four years. They also wrap up the series 2-0
